result.execSummary:
The defendant Vashonn William Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to make contact with a Department of Corrections representative within 48 hours.
Concurrent with: Bayfield Co. cases 21CM2, 21CF25 & 21CF49

miscConds.notes: Fine, costs and domestic abuse surcharge totaling $365.60.   If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant to pay any restitution if requested.

Defendant is to submit DNA sample and pay $200.00 surcharge.   If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant to complete a mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.
To have no abusive contact with victim. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess/consume any alcohol and no consumption of illegal drugs.
Defendant is to undergo any other counseling or conditions as determined by Department of Corrections. Defendant to complete moral recognition therapy and domestic violence education.
Defendant is to complete an AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations coming from that assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared by v/c from Bayfield County Jail, parties by zoom
Preliminary hearing on January 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant appeared by v/c from Bayfield County Jail

This bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.   We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part.   Defendant is to have no contact with victim, specifically under 940.47, meaning no contact regardless of custody status;   stay as least 1,000 ft away from the victim and victim's residence.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess/consume any alcohol and no consumption of illegal drugs.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription; take prescribed medications only as prescribed for the defendant.  This bond covers 21CM2, 21CF49, 21CF25 and 22CF2.
